case_vignette: A 21-year-old man comes to the military base physician for evaluation of progressive discomfort in his right shoulder for the past 4 months. He joined the military 6 months ago and is part of a drill team. In anticipation of an upcoming competition, he has been practicing rifle drills and firing exercises 8 hours a day. Physical examination shows tenderness to palpation and a firm mass in the superior part of the right deltopectoral groove. Range of motion is limited by pain and stiffness.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
